details: Should not be forgotten in the treatment of tubercular meningitis, both as a local application to the head and internally. (BACIL.) TUBERCULOUS CONDITIONS. Subacute and chronic diarrhoea of children.

Head: Head feels heavy, as if it could not be lifted from pillow
Sharp, neuralgic pain
Very drowsy
Itching of occiput meningitis
Sleep interrupted by sighing and cries
Abdomen: Chronic diarrhoea; stools greenish, watery, undigested, with irritable temper
Eyes: Pupils, dilated; contract unequally, react poorly
Failing sight due to retrobulbar neuritis, central scotoma - partial atrophy of optic disc
Chest: Sore pain in apex of right lung
Pain in left breast, like a hand grasping at the base of the heart
Feeling of a weight on chest, as if smothering
Cough and wheezing on going to bed
Extremities: Legs weak; cannot stand and walk with eyes closed
Weakness of knees when going upstairs

name: Iodoformum
dosage: Second trituration. Three grains on the back of the tongue will relieve attack of asthmatic breathing.
